div.documentation: The properties that provide configuration of the JSF configuration files.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'request'
Optional, defaults to 'faces-config.xml'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'jsf'
Optional, defaults to '10240000'
Optional, defaults to '512000'
Optional, defaults to 'request'
Optional, defaults to 'request'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'ods'

div.documentation: Properties related to the generation of the web-tier part of the manageable entities (also known as the CRUD feature).

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'ValueObject'
Optional, defaults to '36'
Optional, defaults to 'ref_'

div.documentation: Properties related to the configuration of messages and internationalization in general.

a.title: Required
Optional, defaults to 'true'

Optional, defaults to 'AndroMDAADFContext'
Optional, defaults to '{0}BackingList'
Optional, defaults to '{0}BackingValue'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Impl'

Optional, defaults to 'jsfMessages'

Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.presentation.gui.components'
Optional, defaults to 'includes.jspf'
Optional, defaults to '{0}LabelList'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.presentation.gui'
Optional, defaults to 'message-resources'
Optional, defaults to 'PatternMatchingExceptionHandler'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to '{0}'
Optional, defaults to '45'
Optional, defaults to 'client'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'UseCaseForwards'
Optional, defaults to '{0}ValueList'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Populator'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'UTF-8'

div.documentation: Properties available for portlet support configuration.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'trinidad'
Optional, defaults to 'GenericFaceletsPortlet'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.presentation.gui.GenericFaceletsPortlet'
Optional, no default value available

div.documentation: These properties provide the ability to configure DB paging support for tables used by the cartridge (this is very.

a.title: Optional, no default value available

div.documentation: Properties related to the configuration of the user interface layout.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to '10'
Optional, defaults to 'vbr'
Optional, defaults to 'ThemePanel'
Optional, defaults to 'sidebar'
Optional, defaults to 'preferences'
Optional, defaults to 'Preferences'
Optional, defaults to 'default'

div.documentation: These properties configure the validation of user input as well as the security.

a.title: Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'FORM'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'annotations'
Optional, defaults to 'MM/dd/yyyy'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to '3'
Optional, defaults to 'xml csv excel pdf'
Optional, defaults to 'HH:mm'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'

Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'

Optional, defaults to 'index.jsp'
Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which configuration files are generated. These are the files that typically appear in WEB-INF, such as faces-config.xml, web.xml, validation-rules.xml, etc.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which any customizable configuration files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which any customizable resources will be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which JSF libraries will be generated (these are the libraries required for JSF support, myfaces libraries, etc). If this isn't defined, its expected that the libraries will be provided by another means.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which JSF/Seam libraries will be generated in the app folder (these are the libraries required for JSF/Seam support which is most importantly jboss-seam.jar). If this isn't defined, its expected that the libraries will be provided by another means.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which any controllers are generated (this outlet contains classes which are fully generated and should not be touched).

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which controller implementations are generated (these are where your hooks go to your services).

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which any additional managed beans are generated (including layout options, etc).

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which message resource bundles are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: Where the application views (JSPs, Facelets, etc) are output.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The forms to which input is stored are output here.

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the JSF configuration file (this file stores the JSF managed bean form information and navigation rules).

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: Comma separated list of URIs of (additional) faces config files. (e.g. /WEB-INF/jsf-config.xml). See JSF 1.0 PRD2, 10.3.2

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: The scope to given the forms. This value can be overriddem by a tagged value.

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: The scope to given the controllers.

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: The scope to given the navigation items.

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation:
The extension used for the application's handling of JSF/Seam pages :
jsf
seam

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: The extension used for the ODS (Open Document Spreadsheet) export.

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: Maximum memory per request (in bytes) for file uploads.

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: Maximum memory per request (in bytes) for file uploads.

a.title: Go to Configuration namespace element group

td.documentation: Uses 'redirect' instead of 'forward' to navigate between views.

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not a preferences menu item should be included in the menu (this menu item allows you to control skinning, etc).

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not a ods should be included in the table.

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the name of the preferences class (which allows dynamic control of the UI's view preferences; skinning, etc).

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: The default skin to be applied (i.e look and feel of the application). If you use 'none', it will disable the skinning feature.

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the bean name under which the preferences class will be stored.

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation:
The menu layout. Valid values are:
hbr
hur
hul
vbr
vur
vur

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: The default value to set for the maximum rows displayed in a table.

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: The navigation theme to use (the possible choices are: ThemeOffice, ThemeMiniBlack, ThemeIE, ThemePanel).

a.title: Go to UI Layout namespace element group

td.documentation: Controls the way navigation items are displayed

a.title: Go to Messages and i18n namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the application (this is used as the display name of the application).

a.title: Go to Messages and i18n namespace element group

td.documentation: Denotes the way application resource messages ought to be generated. When messages are normalized it means that elements with the same name will reuse the same label, even if they are located in entirely different use-cases or pages. This results in resource bundles that are not only smaller in size but also more straightforward to translate. The downside is that it will be less evident to customize labels for certain fields (which is rarely the case anyway).

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the type of view to render, currently the options are: 'jsp' or 'facelets'.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Use Seam.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Use Tomahawk.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Use Tomahawk extension.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: The path of the file that will be the welcome file (minus the extension).

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: The path to the file that provides the login page (minus the extension).

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: The path to the file that provides application logout (minus the extension)

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: The default size to use for multi select boxes.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the Facelet development support should be enabled (in the generated web.xml), this is useful to enable when developing with Facelets, however should be disabled when going to production.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the MyFaces development support should be enabled (in the generated web.xml), this is useful to enable when developing with MyFaces, however should be disabled when going to production.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the generate project as standalone.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: The default date format to use in case it has not been explicitly specified, for event parameters. Take a look here to see how to properly construct date formats.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: Specifies whether or not date and time formats are to be strictly matched. This property takes either true or false as values. If set to true all dates and times entered by the end-user will fail validation if they do not strictly adhere to their given format. Note that this strictness can always be overriden locally using the andromda_struts_view_field_format tagged value.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: The default time format to use when it has not been explicitly specified for event parameters. Take a look here to see how to properly construct time formats.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: If specified denotes the default length of text input fields, the value specifies the size attribute of the corresponding input or textarea element. Not speciying any valid value will make the cartridge ignore it and resort to the default browser value by not rendering any size attribute.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

td.documentation: If specified denotes the default number of rows of textarea elements. Not specifying any valid value will make the cartridge ignore it and resort to the default browser value by not rendering any size attribute.

a.title: Go to Views namespace element group

tr.td: Default value: xml csv excel pdf

td.documentation: The types of files to which a table can be exported.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The security realm to use when security is enabled.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The auth-method of the login-config section.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The default role of all secured elements.

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation:
Indicates whether to use a validation extension, beyond the default JSF. Valid values are:
none
annotations
commons-validator

a.title: Go to Validation and Security namespace element group

td.documentation: Indicates whether or not validation should occur on the client side.

a.title: Go to Portlet Support namespace element group

td.documentation:
The type of portlet container being used with this web app. Setting this property changes the application from standalone to a portlet. Valid values are:
liferay

a.title: Go to Portlet Support namespace element group

td.documentation: The value of the portlet class in the portlet.xml

a.title: Go to Portlet Support namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the default portlet class to use.

a.title: Go to Portlet Support namespace element group

td.documentation:
The AJAX library to use (ICEFaces is the only one supported at this time). Valid values are:
icefaces
trinidad
adf

a.title: Go to Table Paging (DB paging) namespace element group

td.documentation: This is the fully qualified name of the class that provides the pagination results supplied from the middle tier; like a service operation. (i.e. if using the Spring cartridge, you'd set this as name.of.your.model.package.PaginationResult where "name.of.your.model.package" is the name of your model's root package). This must be defined in order for the PageableDataModel class to be generated (which is required for DB backed paging support).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The JNDI name prefix used to construct the JNDI name pattern.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to use for the virtual host (if one is required). For example application.myserver.com.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not forms should be serialized to disk (and therefore stored for later retrieval for example when the user's session is lost). This just provides simple perisistence for the application state.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the temporary variable that stores the current ADF faces context (this should typically not be changed).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class containing all use case forwards.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The number of minutes the session may be idle before timeout occurs.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the web application should be considered distributable; this means that the session will be persisted and restored.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The JSF state saving method to use within the application (can be either client or server).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The fully qualified type name to use when file types are modeled for parameters (used for for file uploads).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Indicates whether or not dummy data should be rendered (in places like controllers).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give the form populator utility class. This utility class provides JSF's form population when transferring information from one form to another during application flow.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used for constructing a parameter's backing list name. A backing list is used when you want to select the value of the parameter from a list (typically used for drop-down select input types).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used for constructing a parameter's backing value name. A backing value is used with an input table type (when you want to submit values from a table of complex objects).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used for constructing the label list name (stores the list of possible parameter value labels).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used for constructing the values list name (stores the list of possible parameter values when selecting from a list).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used for constructing converters (like the enumeration converter), where {0} is the name of the model element.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used to construct the view form populator filter, where {0} is the name of the view.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the the package in which any extra managed-beans will be generated (such as the layout options class, etc).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the the package to which any JSF components generated by the cartridge reside.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use for constructing the form name, where {0} is the name of the controller operation capitalized.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use for constructing the form implementation name, where {0} is the name of the controller operation capitalized.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the name of the property on a form that stores messages.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern for constructing the name of the bean under which the form is stored, where {0} is the name of the use case and {1} is the name of the trigger.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern for constructing the name of the controller implementation class name (where {0} represents the modeled name of the controller).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the key under which each action for is stored. This form is passed along from action to action in order to transfer all parameters.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The path of the localized message resources (the .properties suffix is appended to this value when creating the actual file.).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the name of the default includes file (this contains any message resources as well as tag libs.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the package in which to create the service files, {0} can be used to denote the package in which the service has been modeled.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
The pattern to use when calling the backend code for <<Service>> lookups. For calling services you would use following patterns:
Spring: ${application.package}.ServiceLocator.instance().get{1}()
EJB: ${myPackage}.{1}Util.getHome().create()

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Used to define the pattern used for retrieving message resource keys from exceptions. This is useful when exceptions are thrown from the business tier and you want to map these to messages in your presentation. Normally you won't need to change this pattern, however you may want to if you want to enable it to handle exceptions you may have no control over (i.e. SQLExceptions). Currently the default pattern supports an exception with an embedded {some.resource.key} type key.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give the pattern matching exception handler.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Use autocomplete instead of select, to select related entities.

a.title: Go to Manageable Entities namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix used for hidden form input fields when pre-filling an entity reference after switching, this property should only be changed if you have form fields whose name could conflict with these extra fields.

a.title: Go to Manageable Entities namespace element group

td.documentation: The maximum number of characters to allow in a managed entity's table (remainder is truncated using an ellipsis).

a.title: Go to Manageable Entities namespace element group

td.documentation: The suffix to append to the names of generated value objects used in CRUD (manageable entities).

a.title: Go to Manageable Entities namespace element group

td.documentation: Show a confirmation message after each CRUD operation.
